DOC.HEADLINE: TENNIS ; MARTIN AND LENDL OUSTED FROM FLORIDA TOURNAMENT
DOC.TEXT: Todd Martin and Ivan Lendl were eliminated in third-set tiebreakers in the second round of the Lipton Championships at Key Biscayne , Fla. , on Sunday , but top-seeded Pete Sampras and Steffi Graf both won easily . Martin , who will play for the U.S. Davis Cup team at India in two weeks , lost to Byron Black of Zimbabwe , 4-6 , 6-2 , 7-6 ( 7-5 ) . A finalist at the Australian Open , Martin continued his recent slump by losing for the third time in five matches . The American , ranked ninth in the world , said he is weary from already playing in six tournaments this year . " I think I just need a_few days_off , and hopefully I ' ll get the energy back in my legs and in my head , " Martin said . " I ' ll just do something other_than run_around on a piece of cement. " Lendl , meanwhile , squandered two match_points , including one on a disputed call , and lost to Jan Siemerink of the_Netherlands , 3-6 , 7-5 , 7-6 ( 7-5 ) . Sampras , the defending champion , ousted Diego Nargiso , 6-2 , 6-2 , and fourth-seeded Jim Courier rallied to defeat Jeff Tarango of Manhattan Beach , 2-6 , 6-4 , 6-4 . Spain ' s Javier Sanchez defeated his older brother Emilio , 3-6 , 6-2 , 6-4 , for his first victory in eight matches this year and his first in 10 against Emilio . In women ' s play , Graf defeated Ginger Helgeson , 6-2 , 6-1 , for her 28th consecutive victory . Second-seeded Aranxta Sanchez Vicario , the two-time defending champion , defeated Patty Fendick , 6-1 , 6-3 , and third-seeded Gabriela Sabatini eliminated Chanda Rubin , 6-3 , 6-2 .
